This is why I launched a bipartisan congressional task force of members representing districts facing similar ETO situations across country that will concentrate pressure on the U.S. EPA. The health of our communities is on the line, & it’s time for the U.S. EPA to do its job.
The U.S. EPA must stop the delay, release science-based guidelines that regulate the use of ethylene oxide, and engage with our communities so the public has trust in the safety of our air.

The most recent round of testing in Lake County continues to show significant amounts of ethylene oxide in our communities. The U.S. EPA’s inaction in light of these and previous testing results is absolutely unacceptable. https://twitter.com/newssun/status/1199400118946082821 …

We need to get to net-zero carbon emissions to prevent irreversible damage to our world. The 100% Clean Economy Act is a comprehensive plan to get us to that vital goal. I am proud to be an original cosponsor. Read about it here: https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/schneider-announces-introduction-100-clean-economy-act?fbclid=IwAR3JAtymCqE4TmNGauMqZ7uYNfqsa5fFhGIAJL7GsWNzAb_sugey1JLjYS4 …

Since we learned of ethylene oxide emissions last year, our Illinois delegation has been pushing the U.S. EPA to do its job, release science-based rules, and engage with the public. But this issue stretches far beyond just our state - which is why we formed this task force.

Today, I'm launching a bipartisan congressional task force focused on ethylene oxide with my colleague from Georgia @CongressmanHice. Together, we will concentrate pressure on the U.S. EPA to act. Public health is not a partisan issue. https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/schneider-hice-launch-bipartisan-congressional-task-force-ethylene-oxide …

We have the power to save lives with commonsense action, like #HR8 universal background check bill that already passed the House. I urge Leader McConnell to put the interests of the American people ahead of the NRA, and allow this life-saving debate to move forward to a vote.

I am heartbroken for the students, families, and entire community of Santa Clarita in the wake of this horrific shooting. We can never grow numb to these tragedies or accept as normal the daily gun violence that claims victims across our country.
